III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/4/24, staff member was staring at youth's crotch and drew on
youth's leg with their fingers.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/On-Call Clinician was interviewed via phone on
2/6/24. Complainant reported Youth A went to the emergency
room due to a medical need because of a self-harm episode.
While at the hospital, Youth A told Social Worker at the hospital
she was sexually assaulted. Complainant reported Youth A
completed a recipient rights complaint. Complainant reported Staff
1 was Youth A’s 1:1 staff for approximately one hour on Sunday,
2/4/24.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the hospital on
2/12/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported
there was an incident on 2/4/24 where Staff 1 inappropriately
touched her. Youth A reported she was sitting at the table in the
milieu and Staff 1 was her 1:1 staff member. She reported while
they were sitting at the table together, he was using his finger to
go in circles up her leg from her knee to her thigh, while her leg
was under the table. Youth A reported there was no one else
sitting at the table or anywhere near them, so no one saw
anything. Youth A reported she jerked her leg away and went to
the corner of the milieu to get away from him. Youth A reported
Staff 1 followed her because she was on 1:1 supervision and staff
must be within arm’s length of her. Youth A reported Staff 1 was
making her uncomfortable but wasn’t saying or doing anything
specifically to make her feel that way when they were away from
the table. Youth A reported later in the day she went to the
hospital because she tried to commit suicide because she
reported having flashbacks of the day being raped by her brother.
Youth B was interviewed via phone on 2/15/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported she doesn’t have any
concerns with Staff 1 and hasn’t heard any concerns about him.
Youth B doesn’t remember sitting at a table with Staff 1, Youth A,
Youth C and Youth D.
2

Youth C was interviewed via phone on 2/15/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported Youth A told her Staff 1
had touched Youth A inappropriately. Youth C reported a couple
days later, Youth A reported Staff 1 got fired because they took
Youth A’s clothes, tested them, and found “boy stuff” on them.
Youth C reported she thought it was weird because she knows
Youth A from another facility, and Youth A made similar
allegations about a male staff at that facility too. Youth C reported
these allegations are not true and she’s upset they were made
because they could ruin Staff 1’s life, which is not fair. Youth C
reported she was present on the day in question. Youth C
reported Staff 1 was never just 1:1 with Youth A without others
being right near them. Youth C reported she, Youth B and Youth
D were sitting at the table with Youth A and Staff 1. Youth C
reported Staff 1 wasn’t sitting next to Youth A at the table and was
never close enough to Youth A to touch her. Youth C reported
Staff 1 was sitting in a green chair he had pulled up to the table,
which was at the opposite end of where Youth A was sitting.
Chief Administrator (CA)/Therapist was interviewed face to
face at the facility on 2/6/24 in conjunction with MDHHS
Worker. CA/Therapist reported Staff 1 was Youth A’s 1:1 staff
member on 2/4/24 because of Youth A’s self-harm behaviors and
hiding contraband. CA/Therapist reported there has never been
any concerns with Staff 1’s performance. CA/Therapist reported
Staff 1 is not currently scheduled for shifts pending this
investigation.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/15/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 notified him Youth
A made sexual abuse allegations against him. Staff 1 reported he
works approximately 1 shift per week. Staff 1 reported on 2/4/24,
Staff 2 had been Youth A’s 1:1 staff member, but needed to do
some paperwork, so she asked Staff 1 to take over for the last
hour of the shift. Staff 1 reported he was sitting at a table with
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D. Staff 1 reported he never
sat at the table alone with Youth A and wasn’t sitting next to her at
the table. Staff 1 reported he was at least an arm’s length or two
away from her. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was sitting a few feet away
from the table working on paperwork. Staff 1 reported eventually
Youth A got up from the table and sat on the floor by the door
leading outside of the unit, so he sat approximately 5-10 feet away
from her, so she didn’t feel backed into a corner. Staff 1 reported,
as a rule, he never initiates any physical contact with youth, other
than the occasional fist bump. Staff 1 reported when he is a 1:1
staff member, he makes sure he is observing the youth, but
3

doesn’t want to make them feel uncomfortable or like they’re
under a microscope because it can escalate them further. Staff 1
reported the whole time he was a 1:1 staff for Youth A, he was
talking to other staff members and other youth. Staff 1 reported he
never looked at her private parts, and never made any physical
contact with her of any sort.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she initially heard about
the allegations because she overheard Youth A telling her foster
care worker about the allegations during a phone call. Staff 2 was
surprised Youth A would say those things because none of it was
true. Staff 2 reported she was Youth A’s 1:1 staff member on
2/4/24 but asked Staff 1 to take over so she could complete
paperwork. Staff 2 reported she was still on the milieu and
observing everything going on while she was completing
paperwork. Staff 2 reported she was still watching Youth A intently
because Youth A self-harms so easily, and Staff 2 wanted to
make sure she was ready to respond if anything happened. Staff 2
reported Youth A was sitting by the entrance door with Youth B
and Youth D watching a video on her tablet and Staff 1 was sitting
2 doors down from her on her right side. Staff 2 noted Staff 1 was
not able to look at her private parts or touch her from where he
was sitting. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was never alone with Youth A,
never sat next to her at a table and wasn’t ever close enough to
Youth A to touch her.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he was working the day in
question. Staff 4 reported he didn’t remember Staff 1 sitting at a
table while they were working. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 was
standing in the milieu against a wall most of the shift. Staff 4
reported while he was present, he doesn’t remember seeing Staff
1 close to Youth A or interact with her.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Close Observation Log for Youth A dated 2/4/24 notes Staff
1 was her 1:1 staff member from approximately 2:54 pm to
3:35 pm.
• Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Standards for
Staff-Client Relationships Policy states any relationship
with a person served that is non-professional in nature is
not acceptable, which includes any type of sexual
relationship. Staff members shall not take advantage of a
person served for personal benefit.
4

• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed New Employee Orientation
(policies for the facility) on 5/22/23, Trauma Informed Care
training on 6/13/23, and Orientation to Recipient Rights on
6/20/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. There is no evidence to support the
allegations. Youth A reported she and Staff 1 were alone at the
table together when the alleged incident occurred. However, Staff
1, Staff 2, and Youth C all report Staff 1 was never alone at the
table with Youth A and was never close enough to touch her.
CONSULTATION:
• Youth A disclosed it’s very easy to find things in the milieu
to self-harm with. For example, she said when the floor is
swept, pieces of glass or rocks end up along the wall. It is
recommended this is a focus area for additional cleaning.
• Youth A also disclosed she is very sneaky when staff
members assist her in getting personal items out of her
cubby. CA/Therapist noted they no longer allow Youth A to
have access to getting items, and staff are required to get
the items for her.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
